topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/54d6e58b6368723363880400#post_54d6e58b6368723363880400
Even the lady at the museum was like "are you sure about this"
The key with handling spiders is slow movements. If you start shaking all over they're liable to bite. The thing about spiders, venomous spiders in particular is that they don't actually want to bite things exponentially bigger than them. If they can't eat it then tt's a waste of venom.
